intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. squalidiforme, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides. It is known for its robust growth and ability to spread through rhizomes, making it both a common weed and a subject of ecological study.
